page.title: 17FARMING IN THE SUMMER
page.content: During the summer the farmers have many important things to do to ensure that their farm and animals survive the long, cold, windy winter. One of the most vital things is to make sure the animals have food when the fields are bare or covered in snow. This involves hay or silage making which usually takes place through the months of July and August - and occupies nearly all of the farmer's time in those months. After this there are usually oats to be brought in; these are also fed to the animals. Another important job is the maintenance of farm buildings to make them proof enough to last through the gales and storms which often occur during the winter.
